akn:content.akn:p: A nonprofit corporation may pay reasonable compensation or reimburse reasonable expenses to members, directors, delegates, members of a designated body, or officers for services rendered.

A nonprofit corporation may confer benefits upon or make contributions to members or nonmembers in conformity with its purposes, repurchase its memberships only to the extent provided in ยง 29-404.22, or repay capital contributions, except when:
A nonprofit corporation may make distributions of cash or property to members upon dissolution or final liquidation only as permitted by this chapter.
